title: Low Priority Queue Appeals
body:
Have you even had your internet drop out in the middle of a round and become low priority queued, well I have an idea for my fellow low priority queue members. An appeal, so that if it wasn't your fault and you did everything possible to rejoin the game, you can appeal the banishment to low priority and get back into the action. Now i am not condoning people that leave because they didn't get the lane they wanted etc. but people for whom the game dropped out on and they did everything in their power to rejoin.

If you have any ideas on the format, or an opinion feel free to comment.

replies.body: Can someone please un ban me from low proitynumber one my game had 20 fps ping was so high It was laggy and I got disconnted someone please un ban me

> Have you even had your internet drop out in the middle of a round and become low priority queued

No because I never leave matches intentionally and always ensure my connection is stable (which is actually stated in the TOU and EULA). That's all it takes.

> An appeal, so that if it wasn't your fault and you did everything possible to rejoin the game, you can appeal the banishment to low priority and get back into the action.

You can do this already, you know. Just jump on the support section of the website (link at the top of the page) and send in a ticket describing your situation. You're never guaranteed to get "off the hook" though, so don't be disappointed if they tell you "tough sh!t, deal with it".
I would like to appeal my low priority ban. Who do I contact?
